programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Philadelphia and Denver split victories in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Nuggets claiming a 111-105 win in the final matchup in Jan. 2024; Nikola Jokic posted 26 points and 16 rebounds for Denver in the home victory.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Phoenix claimed victories over Golden State in their first three meetings of the 2023-2024 season before suffering a 113-112 defeat in the final matchup on Feb. 10; Steph Curry posted 30 points and 9 rebounds for the Warriors in the win at home.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Phoenix claimed victories over Golden State in their first three meetings of the 2023-2024 season before suffering a 113-112 defeat in the final matchup on Feb. 10; Steph Curry posted 30 points and 9 rebounds for the Warriors in the win at home.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: North Carolina (13-9, 6-4) dropped three of its last four games, but won both meetings last season; No. 2 Duke (18-2, 10-0) won 14-straight games, and is 12-0 at home behind Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC in scoring with 19.9 ppg.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: They Call It Late Night with Jason Kelce
programme.desc: Super Bowl champion Jason Kelce hosts his own late-night talk show with some help from his wife, Kylie, featuring his infectious brand of humor mixed in with interviews with celebrity guests across football, sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 11 Kansas (15-5, 6-3) won six of its last eight games after a 91-87 win over UCF behind Zeke Mayo; Baylor (13-7, 5-4) is 9-1 at home this season, and won its last four home meetings with the Jayhawks after an 82-74 win last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 1 Auburn (19-1, 7-0) won 12-straight games behind Johni Broome, who is second in the SEC in scoring at 18.2 ppg and first in both rebounds at 11.2 rpg and blocks at 2.8 bpg; No. 23 Ole Miss (16-5, 5-3) is 10-1 at home behind Sean Pedulla.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 5 Florida (18-2, 5-2) blew out the Volunteers, 73-43, on Jan. 7 behind 18 points from Alijah Martin and 16 from Denzel Aberdeen; No. 8 Tennessee (17-4, 4-4) is 11-1 at home this season, and is top five in scoring defense, allowing 59.3 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Gonzaga (16-6, 7-2) won its last two games after a 98-60 win over Oregon State behind Graham Ike, who is fourth in the WCC with 17.3 ppg; Saint Mary's (19-3, 9-0) won nine-straight games, and won two of three meetings last season.

programme.title: 2025 NFL Pro Bowl Games
programme.desc: Head coach Eli Manning and the NFC look to make it three-straight wins over coach Peyton Manning and the AFC, as the two all-star squads compete in various skills competitions, capped off with a flag football game between the teams.

programme.title: 2025 NFL Pro Bowl Games
programme.desc: Head coach Eli Manning and the NFC look to make it three-straight wins over coach Peyton Manning and the AFC, as the two all-star squads compete in various skills competitions, capped off with a flag football game between the teams.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Arkansas (12-8, 1-6) comes off a 65-62 loss to Oklahoma, and is 3-5 away from home; No. 12 Kentucky (15-5, 4-3) is third in the country in scoring, averaging 87.6 ppg behind Otega Oweh, who leads the Wildcats with 15.8 ppg, and is 11-1 at home.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Los Angeles and New York split victories in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season with the Lakers claiming a 113-105 win in the final matchup on Feb. 3; LA's LeBron James and Austin Reaves combined for 46 points in the victory away from home.

programme.desc: Analysts discuss the upcoming matchup between the stars of both the AFC and NFC, including interviews with members of coaching staffs, as well as look back at some of the accomplishments and stats of players on each team throughout the 2018 season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Pittsburgh (14-6, 5-4) won two straight after a 73-65 win over North Carolina; Wake Forest (15-6, 7-3) is 10-1 at home behind Hunter Sallis, who is fourth in the ACC in scoring with 18.6 ppg, and won all six home meetings with the Panthers.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State (9-11, 3-6) won its last two games after an 85-57 win over Oklahoma State; No. 3 Iowa State (17-3, 7-2) is 11-0 at home behind Curtis Jones, who is second in the Big 12 with 18.1 ppg, and won four of the last six meetings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 22 Texas Tech (16-4, 7-2) won five straight behind JT Toppin, who is fourth in the Big 12 at 16.4 ppg; No. 6 Houston (17-3, 9-0) won 13 straight behind the top scoring defense in the country, allowing 55.6 ppg, and won both meetings last season.

programme.desc: Highly-regarded documentarians detail intriguing sports stories; including scandals, memorable events on and off the field, spectacular feats and heartbreaking moments; seldom-seen footage and exclusive interviews help tell the story.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgia (15-6, 3-5) ended a four-game skid with a 71-60 win over South Carolina; No. 4 Alabama (18-3, 7-1) is the top scoring team in the country, averaging 90.4 ppg behind Mark Sears, and won six of its last seven meetings with the Bulldogs.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston is joined by his friend Garry Mason on a fishing expedition to Missouri in hopes of finding trophy-caliber crappie and bass, discussing the equipment they are using on the trip and their techniques they are implementing to find success.

programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.desc: Dayton (14-7, 4-4) had its three-game winning streak snapped by St. Bonaventure, 75-53, but won both meetings last season; Saint Louis (13-8, 6-2) is 11-1 at home behind Robbie Avila and Gibson Jimerson, who are both top five in A-10 scoring.

programme.desc: The top 10 title fights in UFC history are examined and explored, showcasing how these brawlers battled for vacant championships, defended titles or claimed them for their own; highlights share how these fights became instant classics.

programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The most memorable games throughout the history of the NFL are replayed, reliving some of the marquee matchups on the biggest stages, impressive performances from the biggest names in the sport, unbelievable comebacks and playoff classics.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: ESPN experts Field Yates and Mel Kiper Jr. follow the NFL Draft throughout the year, breaking down the stock of players who have risen and fallen during the college football season, what each team needs to draft and the latest trade news.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Extensive features on current sports topics and the upcoming seasons, along with inspiring storylines and profiles, showcase the reach sports have with a further in-depth examination on the finer points of what it means to be a sports fan.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: From 1990-1993, the Buffalo Bills were known as much for their talent as their fighting in the locker room, but the team managed to come together to make a series of memorable Super Bowl runs that all ended in disappointment.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Qualifying
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers qualify for the Cook Out Clash at Bowman Gray Stadium, vying for the fastest times to claim the best possible start positions; Bowman Gray Stadium in North Carolina is back to hosting NASCAR for the first time since 1971.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Indiana (14-7, 5-5) is 3-5 away from home this season; No. 10 Purdue (16-5, 8-2) is 10-1 at home behind Trey Kaufman-Renn, who leads the Boilermakers with 18.1 ppg, and won both meetings with the Hoosiers last season, including a 79-59 home win.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Utah claimed a 69-48 victory over Arizona in their first meeting of the season on Dec. 31, led by an 18-point, 9-rebound performance from Gianna Kneepkens; Lauryn Swann posted 22 points and an assist for the Wildcats in the loss at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 17 Wisconsin (16-5, 6-4) dropped two of its last three games, but won nine of the last 11 meetings; Northwestern (12-9, 3-7) is 10-2 at home this season behind Nick Martinelli, who is third in the Big Ten in scoring with 19.6 ppg.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Players bowl three rounds of 24 games across three oil patterns to qualify for round robin play; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle in the Delaware Classic at Mid-County Lanes & Entertainment Center in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.title: College Basketball
